quiz.text: Find the ratio of sum the ages of B, D and E after 3 years to sum of the ages of F, G and H, 4 years ago?
options: 21:16
19:13
20:11
22:17
17:10

quiz.text: After ‘t’ years, A got married to P and at the time of marriage, P’s age was 8 years more than the average of present ages of E and F. If after 3 years of marriage a baby was born and average of the ages of A, P, and their child after 6 years of marriage is 21 years, then find the value of ‘t’?
options: 6 years
5 years
8 years
7 years
9 years

quiz.text: Average of the present ages of A, B, D, E, and F is what percent of the sum of the present ages of C, G, and H?
options: 33.2%
37.3%
31.8%
35.6%
39.1%

quiz.text: In Sharma family, if no one is above 90 years old, which of the following can be the age of second eldest member?
options: 34
52
44
56
More than one of the above

quiz.text: If the ratio of the present age of P and R is 12: 5, what will be the ratio of the age of Q and S after 8 years?
options: 2: 1
4: 3
5: 3
2: 5
3: 2

quiz.text: 6 years ago, the age of Roma's father was 14 years more than her only one brother and only one sister. Find the age of the sister of Roma after 12 years. Statement I: Roma is 20 years younger than her father and her present age is 116.66% of her brother. Statement II: 4 years ago, the age of her brother is 166.66% of her Sister Statement III:  8 years hence, Age of her Father is same as sum of ages of her brother and Sister.
options: Statement I and II together is sufficient to answer the question
Statement II and III together is sufficient to answer the question
Statement III and I together is sufficient to answer the question
Combination of any two statement is sufficient to answer the question
None of these

quiz.text: There are five members in a family – P, Q, R, S, and T. one fourth of the sum age of all members (except T) is 29 years. Find the age of T. Statement I: Ratio of age of R, S, and T is 9:10:5 respectively and 20% of sum of ages of P and Q is 8 years Statement II: Age of P is 50% more than Q, age of R is 10% less than S, while R is 12 years older than P. Difference between age of S and T is 20 years. Statement III: Difference between Age of Q and T is 4 years. T is not the youngest person in the family.
options: I alone is sufficient to answer
Either I or II alone is sufficient to answer
II alone is sufficient to answer
Either I alone or II and III together is sufficient to answer
Any one of them is sufficient

quiz.text: Age of R after 12 years is 80% more than present age of P, while present age of T is 20% more than S. Find the present average age of P and Q together Statement I: Present age of T is 80% more than P, while after 6 years age of Q is 50% as that of S. Statement II: R is 12 years older than Q, and the respective ratio of age of R and S after 4 years is 14:17. Statement III: P is 4 years younger than R and 8 years older than Q.
options: Either I alone or II alone is sufficient to answer the question
Either I alone or II and III together is sufficient to answer the question
III alone is sufficient to answer the question
Either III alone or I and II together is sufficient to answer the question
None of these

quiz.text: What is the ratio of the ages of Rohit and Mohan? I. 6 years ago their ages were in the ratio 7 : 9. II. After 2 years the younger one’s age will be 25/31 th that of the older. III. The sum of their ages is 12 less than twice the age of the older.
options: Either I alone or II alone is sufficient to answer the question
Either I alone or II and III together is sufficient to answer the question
III alone is sufficient to answer the question
Any two of them is sufficient
None of these

quiz.text: Age of Arun after 4 years will be twice of present age of Varun, while age of Varun after 5 years will be 125% of age of Manisha after four years. Difference between age of Raj and Geeta is 10 years. Find difference between age of Varun and Geeta. Age of all persons is an integral value. Statement I. Varun is 35 years younger than Raj and ratio of age of Manisha before 6 years and age of Geeta after 5 years is in 1:5 respectively. Statement II. Present age of Raj is 275% as that of Varun, while Arun is 20 years elder than Manisha. Statement III. Present age of Arun is 36 years, and ratio of age of Varun after 10 years and age of Raj after 5 years is in 1:2 respectively. Age of eldest person among the five given person is 55 years.
options: Either statement I or II only
Any of the statement alone is sufficient
Either II or III only
Either I or III only
None of these

quiz.text: P = Present age of Arun is 50% more than age of Arun before 12 years, while age of Arun before 6 years is 25% more than that of Varun. Find the average age of Arun and Varun together after ten years. Q = After 9 years, Average age of Arun, Ankita and Aruna is 44 years. Ankita is 12 years younger than Aruna, while present age of Arun is 125% as that of Aruna. Find the age of Ankita after 18 years. R = Sum of Age of Kabir and Bunny is 31 years, while bunny is elder then Kabir. Find the sum of minimum and maximum possible age of Bunny, where age of both is a natural number.
options: P > Q > R
P = Q < R
P < Q < R
P > Q < R
None of these

quiz.text: Age of Arun (A) is 9/5 times age of Sapna(S) while Age of Kabir (K) is 5/9 times less than that of Arun.   Quantity I. (3K – A)/S Quantity II.  (9A – 5K – 4S) / [5/3 x (5A – K)] Quantity III.120% x [A/ 2(K + S)]
options: Quantity I > Quantity II > Quantity III
Quantity I > Quantity II < Quantity III
Quantity I = Quantity II < Quantity III
Quantity I = Quantity II = Quantity III
None of these

quiz.text: Quantity I. 6 years ago, average age of Chintu, Mintu and Sintu is 18 years. The ratio of age of Mintu and Chintu after 6 years is 5:6 and Sintu is 6 years younger than Mintu. Find the age of Mintu after 9 years? Quantity II. Average present age of X, Y and Z is 21 years and average age of X and Z is 17.5 years, find age of Y after 5 years?
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I < quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text: Quantity I: If the present age of P is (x2 – 6) and the present age of Q is (x2 – 12). And the present age of R is (4x+3). If the average age of P, Q and R are 27 years. If the age of A is 2/3 of P and the age of B is 4 years less than A. Find the Total age of A and B. Quantity II: The ratio of the present ages of M and N is a: 7. After (a+3) years age of M is equal to the present age of N. And the difference between the present ages of M and N is 8 years and the age of N is greater than M. If the present age of O is 25℅ more than the present age of N. Then find the present age of O.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or a relation can't be established..

quiz.text: Quantity I: 8 years ago, the average age of A, B and C was 23 years. The ratio of age of B and C after 8 years is 5:6 and A is 11 years younger than B. Find the age of A, after 12 years. Quantity II: Average present age of P, Q and R is 23 years and the average age of P and R is 26.5 years, find the age of Q after 17 years.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or relationship can’t be determined
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II

quiz.text: There are three persons P, Q, and R in a family, their ages arranged in ascending order (P < Q < R). Difference between the present age of P and Q is the same as that of Q and R, while the difference between the ages of P and Q is more than 2. Product of their ages is 400% more than the sum of their ages. Find unit digit of (R – P) 13579. Ages of all three numbers are integers.
options: 6
1
9
4
None of these

quiz.text: Ratio of A’s age 8 years after to present age of B is 3: 5 and B’s present age is 25% of C’s age after 15 years. After 4 years A’s age is 12.5% of D’s age after 4 years. If the sum of the ages of A, B, C and D after 1 year is 101, then what is the present age of B?
options: 18 years
15 years
12 years
14 years
None of these

quiz.text: Ratio of Rajesh age to his first daughter’s age is 15 : 6 and Rajesh's wife age to his second daughter age is 4 : 1. If elder daughter of Rajesh is 11 years elder than other daughter and the average age of the family is 37.25 year than find the average of the age of Rajesh's wife and his first daughter?
options: 26 years
42 years
34 years
38 years
None of these

quiz.text: 12 years ago, the age of Raj was 20% of that of his mother, the age of Raj’s father was 120% of that of Raj’s mother and a new baby girl was born at that time. If present age of Raj is 37.5% of that of his father, then after 6 years the age of Raj’s sister will be what per cent of that of Raj’s mother?
options: 42.5%
37.5%
45.5%
38.5%
32.5%

quiz.text: Present age of Rishi is 20% more than that of Hema and present age of Karan is 25% less than that of Rishi. Average of the present ages of Hema, Rishi and Lalit is 22 years. If after 2 years, age of Lalit will be 20% more than that of Karan, then what will be the ratio of ages of Rishi and Karan after 4 years?
options: 16: 13
11: 8
14: 11
15: 13
13: 9

quiz.text: At the time of the son’s birth age of the father was 30 years and after 3 years when the daughter was born, the age of the mother was 28 years at that time. If the age of the father after 7 years will be 25% more than the age of the mother after 3 years, then the age of the father after 2 years will be ________ percent more than the age of the mother 1 year ago.
options: 20%
16%
24%
30%
25%

quiz.text: Present age of Kriti is 200% more than that of Kruti, 8 years ago 75% sum of Age of Kritma and Kruti was 3/2 of age of Kriti at that time. After 16 years age of Kriti is 28.56% less than that of Kritma. The present Age of Kritma is ________ % more or less than age of Kriti after 32 years.
options: 28.57% less
14.28% more
37.5% less
40% more
None of these

quiz.text: Age of B after 8 years is 50% that of C. D is 4 years older than C and the age of A at the time of birth of B was 30 years. If the sum of ages of B, C, and D is 80 years then the age of A, after 12 years from now will be ______.
options: 42 years
60 years
48 years
54 years
None of these

quiz.text: 8 years ago, Age of P was 4 times of Q, after 12 years the age of P was 13/7 times of Q at that time. If the age of R is the sum of 1.5 times of age of Q and age of P, then the 50% of sum of present age of P, Q, and R together is _________.
options: 80 years
48 years
40 years
36 years
None of these

quiz.text: Find which combination of data is true in the blank according to the question in the same sequence. Present ages of A and B in the ratio ______. The present age of B is ______percent more than the present age of C. Present average age of A, B and C is 36 years and the present age of A is______ years. I. 9:5, 25%, 54 II. 4:3, 50%, 48 III. 3:5, 25%, 27
options: All I, II and III
Only II and III
Only I
Only I and II
Only III
